website_summaries.verdict: Travel-friendly and easy to use, the PalmOne Universal keyboard gets you tapping, whether you dance to Palm or Pocket PC.
pros: works with Palm and Pocket PCs
cons: Keyboard slide mechanism not the smoothest

customer_reviews.title: Universal keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I probably would have purchased the next higher grade of this keyboard if I had to do it over. Although the price is better, the built-in casing tends to pop open when not in use in the brief case. I had to download the program (and sync it) three times before it would work consistently. (I.e. after the first download, it worked fine. Then when I put it away for the night, the next day it would not work and I had to repeat the process twice before it did not consistently without a problem.) If you have bigger than average fingers, stay away from this. While the keyboard is convenient, it is still smaller than standard.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Stan C. Sneeringer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what it does
customer_reviews.text: I've had a T|E for near of ten years now, and even then I always wanted a keyboard to go with it but never had the extra money to throw at it. (not to mention I owned a laptop as well) But at 99 cents how could I refuse. It works just as well as I would expect, and better yet it runs on AAAs so I can always get new batteries for it cheaply (rechargable ones that is)
customer_reviews.author: Sb129

customer_reviews.title: Thanks to all of the other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the other reviews I was able to get this up and running with little effort. First, do as they say and throw away the cd...go to palm support and download the drivers or you will loose your sanity. Second, remember to turn the keyboard on so you can use it..simple as that. I have a Palm TX and they go great together. I love the way the keys respond and how compact it is. Do read the reviews that are technical, they will help you get started with little problem. The reason I gave this a four is because of the cd that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H. Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient, a bit insensitive
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is really convenient. It folds up nicely and can fit in a large pocket. It seems to be able to work with any PDA device with an infrared port on top. But it doesn't quite work as effectively as a normal keyboard, I think because of the infrared connection. I notice that sometimes I'll hit a button, and nothing appears on the screen. I'll hit it several times, then finally it appears, and typing becomes easy. It seems to temporarily loses connection, then regain it. Certainly beats typing on the Treo 650, though!
customer_reviews.author: William L. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Improved
customer_reviews.text: I love my new keyboard. My last one broke from high usage. I purchased this one to replace it. It is new and improved from my first one. I love it for taking notes at meetings. I love the new features they have added. Some of the key controls have changed to make it easier to type in numbers. Being compact makes it easy to carry also. Love it for places that do not require my laptop but where I need to make notes that need to get to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard didn't work. CD-useless; driver out of date, no Getting Started guide. Tried everything-downloaded IR port testing utility. (Palm IR port was fine.) I spent 2 hrs. fussing with it; seller told me to repeat everything I'd tried, & finally refunded $ (I'd already bought a new, unopened keyboard, same model-worked right out of the pkg.) Seller said they'd tested the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Thoress

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at IR keyboards for quite some time, I have a PALM Centro, Treo 700, and an ancient Pocket PC running PALM OS. Although the PALM software wasn't compatible with my Windows 7 computer, it works fine with Vista and XP, and it is a very quick and easy setup, and works like a charm. And it is an awesome alternative to those tiny buttons and handwriting stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tungsten T3 and HP IPAQ
customer_reviews.text: I use this for both a Tungsten T3 and HP IPAQ. (I bought the T3, my employer bought the far inferior HP IPAQ.). The keyboard works well with both. easy set-up, and it detects all letters when I type. The keyboard was designed for the T3 to be in landscape mode. It also works when either PDA is in normal (not landscape) mode, but the PDA is not as secure. If you use it in landscape mode, the PDA is quite secure and could be used on the lap. If you use it in normal mode, it would easily fall off if not used on a table or desk. That is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.....Simply a must have
customer_reviews.text: I have read the reviews for this product and was very hesitant to purchase this, even when I received it and it was supposedly not suitable for my particular model Palm. I have a Palm Tungsten T3 and am extremely happy that I bit the bullet and bought this keyboard. It was an easy plug and play, not problems - touch wood, with the software compatability, and have been using with my palm in place of my Notebook (sometimes I don't like to carry big bags everywhere)and is a brilliant substitute....
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Best accessory for my Dell Axim
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best electronics purchase I've made in the last two years. I now am tied to my desk very little, and there is even less reason to use my laptop. I am able to type at full speed, writing large amounts of text straight into Pocket Word. It requires a little work to format once it's in full Word on the desktop, but the freedom is worth it. The folded keyboard fits in my executive zip-folder and I take it with me everywhere. The coffeeshops have never seen so much of me...
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: As good as can be expected, I suppose
customer_reviews.text: Palm's computers last a lot longer than their peripherals, that's for sure. I tend to have to buy one of these every 6-8 months, but I use it heavily. Great as long as it lasts, though it can't hold up to IR interference. It's always the left side of the keyboard that starts to fail, and for the first time in about eight keyboards, the pin fell out of my last one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid buit and actually wished there was a Bluetooth model as well.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Vinyard

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It was inexpensive with instruction but still can't make it work. maybe I should use a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Ben CC

customer_reviews.title: Great price !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy little keyboard they have with the Palm sure beats using the stylus pen but takes a while to get used to using the keyboard. I'd recommend this to anyone that has a Palm. Shipping was very fast and quality of the product was very good. I give the seller two thumbs up...
customer_reviews.author: tonyhrpcha

customer_reviews.title: SO PORTABLE ... SUCH A GOOD THING
customer_reviews.text: I am not the best sleeper. Which means even while camping when everyone is asleep, I am wide awake. As a poet, portability in my equipment is extremely important to me. I was not keen on trying to write a poem in the Graffiti that comes on my Palm, so I purchased the keyboard. Definitely ONE of my best decisions.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia M Dallas - Author

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful add on to the palm TX
customer_reviews.text: Only few word : a have to device for any palm TX user! You get the best mobile device like this. You can connect a palm TX + this IR keyboard + a bluetooth cell phone as modem to send/receive email, surf on the internet, do some chatting like MSN / jabber and so on.... Becareful with bluetooth keyboard on palm TX, because you can only connect 1 bluetooth device to the palm TX and any palm OS devices. It is very slim too. You can bring it with you anywhere. Very useful to write a report in a train, in a plane or in a waiting room too. I really recommand it.
customer_reviews.author: Philippe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The Palm 3169WW Universal Wireless Keyboard is excellent. Not only is it very compact and light weight, but I need to write a lot of notes, so having the keyboard is invaluable to make the most of my time. Even though the keyboard AA batteries last a long time, the PDA battery will be used faster because the IR signal will be in use while using the keyboard. All in all a fantastic product with a terrific price that cannot be denied. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Handy Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product for the people on the go. it takes 5 seconds to get it opened and start keying into your Palm. It just replaces your computer keyboard so easily that you never miss your computer anymore. Give it a try to believe it. With the case for it, you can fit the keyboard and your palm right into the case and you feel so good that you have your palm and the keyboard so handy always.
customer_reviews.author: Naveen Ramaiah

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: The Palm Wireless Keyboard is a "must-have" for the road warrior. Use of this device is seemless, unlike the docking station keyboards of the past. Battery life with little usage has been over one year now and still going. With the rotating screen of the Palm TX and this wireless keyboard I have afforded myself the option of writing manuscripts without being chained to my desktop computer. Get it and enjoy the freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah II

customer_reviews.title: Great to work with after you get it up and running. . .
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time trying to get this running. The main problem was that the CD that comes with it does not contain the right driver. You must go online and download 1.13 I have not used it a lot yet. I expect it will be a great accessory. Janni
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Palm Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Add Word to your Palm then while you travel, journal to your Palm from the Keyboard. Later, interface the Palm with your computer and transfer your journaled entries to the computer. A great way to turn your Palm into a mini computer.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: I wish!
customer_reviews.text: I wish this item would've worked with my Nextbook! I loved how compact it was! Just pulling it out of itz puzzel state was so much fun! Turns out it was the second of the keyboards I ordered and returned. There is NO keyboard that works with my Nextbook! :-(
customer_reviews.author: Valuebuff

customer_reviews.title: My old one got tossed in the washer and became ...
customer_reviews.text: My old one got tossed in the washer and became unusable. This is the exact replacement and a welcome tool to use.
customer_reviews.author: LC Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, quick setup
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard worked flawlessly out of the box. Pop the CD in your laptop and let it set up the drivers. Then sync. Now you can use your keyboard. Bring along some spare batteries, because they will run out when you least expect it.
customer_reviews.author: Fish-N-Hunt

customer_reviews.title: not too impressed
customer_reviews.text: this disapointed me, it is awkward to set up and never was able to get wifi and yes i followed directions, decided to do without it, when folding it back up pay attention or you will break it,
customer_reviews.author: rrred lips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking at this item for a long time before I took the plunge and bought it. It is an excellent product. It connects easily and worked perfectly right out of the box. I love it for travel. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lay

customer_reviews.title: Great for a portable
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact protected design when closed, full size feel when open. Highly recommended for Palm users or any others that can get an IR keyboard to work for them.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: This wireless keyboard just isn't up to Palm standards. I had one of the original Palm folding keyboards for a Palm III3e and it was terrific, AND reliable! This one never worked worth a flip with my T/X despite driver updates, etc. Can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun

customer_reviews.title: First step to use your Palm as PC
customer_reviews.text: Very useful gadget, makes you feel you're using a mini-computer (little less than a laptop). Despite a few bugs in the software (that require frequent soft-resets) both Palm TX and keyboard work very nice together. For email and word processing this keyboard is a must.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Glad to find this product
customer_reviews.text: Great price and quick delivery. Early adapter - and late departer - from Palm products. This keyboard is perfect for getting the best use from the Palm TX.
customer_reviews.author: Reg Ankrom

customer_reviews.title: Did not last that long.
customer_reviews.text: This is quite dated at this time, I do not use the Palm anymore. However, the keyboard unit worked for awhile and then simply stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne N.

customer_reviews.title: Palm TX wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard makes using the Palm TX a breeze. It works great and allows use in both landscape and portrait mode. Great keyboard. I wish all devices I bought for the TX worked this good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert55

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL INVESTMENT
customer_reviews.text: This key board is wonderful. I love the ease I now have to type up notes and documents on my Palm. It is compact and easy to take along in my purse when I don't want to care a tote bag or brief case.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spanheimer

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This little keyboard is a big help in entering info on the Palm PDA that I have. It beats the heck out of a virtual keyboard. The price of this quality unit was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: It might be wonderful. I can't find out. The driver software from an earlier keyboard will not allow itself to leave my Palm Tungsten E2, so the driver for this keyboard cannot load. I downloaded FileZ file-management software to get rid of the earlier driver, but FileZ reports that it can't delete the older file while it still contains data (?!?) Anyone have any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Sissons

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard for PSP
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Godson and he loves it. It gives him his own computer with out him downloading every game known to man on mine which means my computer does not crash anymore.
customer_reviews.author: denise hess

customer_reviews.title: I wish HP hadn't discontinued the PALM
customer_reviews.text: I still have this - I wish HP hadn't discontinued the PALM - It was a great OS and didn't crash. True multi tasking.
customer_reviews.author: YTE

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is a great idea, but has some problems.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard in hopes of turning a PDA into a laptop without all the hassles and size. The problem is that this keyboard is hard to open and the keys stick sometimes. Not to mention, I have big fingers and the keys are too small to punch. So think about these problems before you purchase this keyboard. It earned two stars in hopes that Palm will improve this product.
customer_reviews.author: Disney Teach

customer_reviews.title: Worked at first
customer_reviews.text: After I got it set up with my Palm T|X, it worked fine the first 2 times I needed to use it. Now it doesn't. I'll continue fiddling with it and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: Neil R. Vig

customer_reviews.title: Palm keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard did not work on my Palm TX. My Palm is about 4 yrs old and still works, but it could be that the IR no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: Palm Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Why do we even bother with laptops when you can have a small portable keyboard and Palm. I used the Palm keyboard all the way through Georgetown University to type notes while in class. It is wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ethel M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Piece of cake
customer_reviews.text: I downloaded and installed the drivers from the Palm site and was up and running in about ten minutes. This works with no problems on my TX.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S. Dean

customer_reviews.title: waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. No support and does not work with my Tungsten E! It is another link in my long chain of regrets and poor decisions. I got suckered in again! When will I learn to not base purchasing decisions on marketing fluff? Drop nearly $120 on the Tungsten and more on a keyboard to expand its capability and, after that expense, have nothing to be satisfied about the purchase.If you insist on givinging your money for a hunk of Jap junk you can send it to me and, at least, receive a "Thank you."
customer_reviews.author: Lamplighter

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Palm and just hate using the on-screen keyboard, this little gem is for you. Keep a supply of AA batteries, however, and sometimes the keys are sticky, but it works for me quite well.
customer_reviews.author: David Dabney

customer_reviews.title: confused about the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: Well, got this several months ago and I have had no complaints. It works either on a desktop or in my lap (if I keep my legs together). No dropped keys, very easy to type on and no misconnects.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mccloud

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard with my Treo and find it very helpful when I don't have my laptop with me. I do genealogy research and can enter information in the documents to go quickly. The setup on the keyboard takes a little getting used to but it's light weight, flips out quickly and works beautifully with the Treo.
customer_reviews.author: K. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Vital Comm
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd keyboard. I can carry it around in my front pocket and use it to type out an Az Vital Comm log and still have lighted power at night. Works better horizontally because it's not as top heavy. Vertically you have to keep your hands on the keyboard to keep it from tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Ladd

customer_reviews.title: Great little item
customer_reviews.text: Item is compact and great for on-the-go-work - at or away from the office. The item is worth more than the low price.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Simply what I expected to get when I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go along with my PSP so It wasn't for a palm pilot at all. Sorry. Even though I did get this for my PSP it works as said and I wish I did have a palm to try it out compleatly because this device is pretty cool folds up real neat and tight. Plus being able to use AAA batteries is a plus since I use rechargeable ones.
customer_reviews.author: HYde

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product but gotta be very careful, any little drop and it's done, will never be able to use it again (even with the case on)
customer_reviews.author: Fernanda

customer_reviews.title: Palm keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works perfectly. My wife uses it to keep track of her office's calendar on her Palm Tungsten E2.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Collier

customer_reviews.title: Palm keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This item works great. I'm very pleased with it. It arrived ver quickly. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works great and seller was wonderful to deal with! A+! I was looking for a portable keyboard for my Palm and was hesitant about buying this but I have been using it for two weeks now and absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: N. Fiorentino

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My previous unit failed after 9 years of use. Wanted to continue using my Palm E2 PDA, so a new keyboard was a must. Very pleased with purchase and all aspects of the transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Thompson

customer_reviews.title: VERY PORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: EXCELENT FOR INTRODUCE DATA OR EDIT CONTACTS IN YOUR PDA, WRITE WORD DOCUMENTS OR CREATE EXCEL FILES. VERY HANDABLE
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Joel Iglesias Castro

customer_reviews.title: portable Palm keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works well. The combined weight of the keyboard and my Palm Tungsten is much less than that of a netbook, a feature that was very important to me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: used keyboard parts missing
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd try to save some money and buy a used keyboard... Parts are missing. My bad luck... Be smart BUY NEW
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Probably great -- if I needed it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really clever product, and would have worked very well, but I found another way to get my notes down and never needed it. Some review, yes?
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Quinn

customer_reviews.title: It is working very well and convenience.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the Palm E2. The software didn't work, and I copy the file into the Palm. After that, it is working very well. I also tried to Palm T/X. Palm T/X is working very well with the software.
customer_reviews.author: Young Park

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with my T3, even with the latest drivers. 3-1-05
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. VERY nice, full keyboard, if it works with your handheld or phone. Though it worked, somewhat, with my T3, the "keyboard" program installed on my T3 couldn't be used/customized, and the driver may have corrupted my T3, forcing me to do a "hard reset", deleting all info on my T3. It didn't actually damage my T3, though, as earlier posters noted, using the earlier/shipped driver that came with the keyboard on the install CD. I think I'll go with a Think Outside brand, "Stowaway" keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: CSK

customer_reviews.title: good keyboard!!!,
customer_reviews.text: ease to use, very comfortable, ease to install and function... you can use your agenda to type long papers, and pass to computer to give format, fits in pocket pans, but to bulky... is IR, function even with pocket if got infra. facil usar, confortable, facil de instalar y funcionar, si tienes que escribir mucho es mas comodo, y pasarlo posteriormente a la computadora para darle formato... cabe en el bolsillo del pantalon, pero muy abultado, es infrarojo, funciona con pocket pc
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Good, not Great
customer_reviews.text: The Treo keyboard folds into a great package, it's easy to type on and works without problems (on my 650). Doesn't hold the 650 well (seems awkward) and I wish it just connected directly--ie through the plug. The infrared works well though.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Barbee

product_meta.title: Palm 3169WW Universal Wireless Keyboard
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
The Palm 3169WWZ Wireless Keyboard is compatible with many popular models of Palm OS and Windows Mobile OS devices. Operating through a infrared sensor, the keyboard is wireless and can be folded into a compact, conveniently portable size. It features the generic "QWERTY" format, and its keys can be customized to allow quick navigation and data entry. This makes it possible to access your favorite sites or open frequently-visited files with only a few keystrokes. The keyboard also works with Pocket PC and Symbian units.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Universal Wireless Keyboard This full-size yet compact keyboard for your Treo 650 or 600 smartphone works without plugging in a single wire. Fold it up and it is small enough to fit it a pocket or purse. Unfold it for a complete keyboard right at your fingertips. Perfect for taking notes or sending email. It is what is unfolding in infrared. .Compatibility: - HP (Hewlett-Packard) HP iPAQ h6300 iPAQ 3955 Color 64MB PocketPC iPaq H1910 Color 48MB PDA iPAQ H1935 Color 64MB SDRAM Pocket PC iPAQ H1945 Color 64MB Pocket PC iPAQ H2210 Color 64MB Pocket PC iPAQ h2215 Color 64MB Pocket PC iPAQ H4150 Color 64MB Pocket PC iPAQ H4350 PDA iPAQ H5450 64MB Pocket PC iPAQ H5455 Color 64MB Pocket PC iPAQ H5550 Color 128MB Pocket PC - PalmOne Handspring Treo 600 (unlocked) Palm Zire 72 Handheld PalmOne Treo 650 (unlocked) PalmOne Tungsten T5 Tungsten C Color 64MB PDA Tungsten E Color 32MB PDA Tungsten T3 64MB PDA Zire 21 8MB PDA Zire 71 Color 16MB PDA - NOTE: Not compatible with Treo 300 270 180 or 90 .Wireless Infrared wand is easily positioned for landscape or portrait display devices..Compatible Works with selected palmOne HP and Dell models..Standard Full English QWERTY keyboard number row 3 alpha rows 1 spacebar row with misc. keys..Compact 5 3/8 X 3 7/8 X 5/8 inches folded .Easy typing Key pitch: 18mm Key travel: 2.5mm Key top dish: 0.15+/-0.05mm (0.11mm measured average) .Lightweight 7.4 oz 210g .Self-powered Internal battery lasts up to four months depending on use..Convenient Application launch keys for common tasks .Easy to setup Comes with Windows setup software (Treo 650 desktop synchronization software required).
feature_bullets: Wireless keyboard compatible with Palm OS, Windows Mobile OS, Pocket PC, and Symbian devices
Operates through infrared sensor for reliable wireless connectivity
Full QWERTY keyboard with five rows of full-size keys
See product description for list of compatible Palm products

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars175 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
